name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. FLUORO-PLASTICS, INCORPORATED, Appellant

judges: Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX, MANDERINO and LARSEN, JJ.
LARSEN, J., dissents and would reach the merits.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. FLUORO-PLASTICS, INCORPORATED, Appellant.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM:
The order of the Commonwealth Court, 28 Pa.Cmwlth. 520, 368 A.2d 1328, is vacated and the case remanded to that court for consideration in light of Commonwealth v. Molycorp, Inc., 481 Pa. 208, 392 A.2d 321 (1978).
LARSEN, J., dissents and would reach the merits.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: C. George Milner, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Joseph F. Lynch, Robert P. Coyne, Deputy Attys. Gen., Harrisburg, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
393 A.2d 13
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. FLUORO-PLASTICS, INCORPORATED, Appellant.
No. 350.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued May 22, 1978.
Decided Oct. 5, 1978.
C. George Milner, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Joseph F. Lynch, Robert P. Coyne, Deputy Attys. Gen., Harrisburg, for appellee.
Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX, MANDERINO and LARSEN, JJ.
